sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: Math.Distance (x1, y1, x2, y2 : real) : real

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Math.Distance is used to calculate the distance between two points. (x1, y1) is the location of the first point, and (x2, y2) is the location of the second point.

sections.raw_content: The parameters to Math.Distance are real, but you can pass integer variables and constants.

sections.title: Example
code:
var x1, y1, x2, y2 : int
        const RADIUS : int := 75
        x1 := Rand.Int (RADIUS, maxx - RADIUS)
        y1 := Rand.Int (RADIUS, maxy - RADIUS)
        x2 := Rand.Int (RADIUS, maxx - RADIUS)
        y2 := Rand.Int (RADIUS, maxy - RADIUS)
        Draw.FillOval (x1, y1, RADIUS, RADIUS, brightred)
        Draw.FillOval (x2, y2, RADIUS, RADIUS, brightgreen)
        if Math.Distance (x1, y1, x2, y2) < RADIUS * 2 then
            put "The two circles touch"
        else
            put "The two circles do not touch"
        end if
